communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: Matthew Ponomarenko
Description/Headline: 
link: https://www.cleveland19.com/2021/03/26/parma-police-year-old-boy-murdered-father-under-arrest/
State:
Law Enforcement: 

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

david yupa

title: FEC communications re Musk's lottery for registered voters

communications.communication:
Dear FEC,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request, in their original format(s) exactly as sent, 
a. all communications sent
 1. to the FEC from a source outside the FEC, or 
 2. from the FEC to a source outside the FEC,
b. regarding the actions of Elon Musk and/or America PAC in its ongoing lottery for registered voters in swing states.

This has been widely reported, e.g.: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2024/10/23/elon-musk-election-giveaway-petition-doj/75813730007/
https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/politics/elon-musk-justice-department-letter/index.html

This request is made for non-profit, public interest, journalistic purposes.

Both the lottery, and the FEC's actions or inactions about it, are issues of extreme and urgent public concern, as it directly affects the fairness and legitimacy of the imminent Federal and swing state elections, and the ongoing lottery still being run at https://petition.theamericapac.org by the richest person on Earth. The FEC's views as to its legality, its possible intentions as to a MUR or other action, and its decision to take or not take pre election action about such activity is of grave public concern, and the widespread public dissemination of these records cannot wait until after the election renders it moot.

I therefore request full fee waiver and IMMEDIATE expedition, with a full release by the end of Monday, Oct 28.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

title: DoJ letter to Musk re lottery for registered voters

communications.communication:
Dear DoJ,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request, in their original format(s) exactly as sent, the letter(s) sent from DoJ to Elon Musk and/or America PAC within the past week regarding his ongoing lottery for registered voters in swing states.

This has been widely reported, e.g.: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2024/10/23/elon-musk-election-giveaway-petition-doj/75813730007/
https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/politics/elon-musk-justice-department-letter/index.html

This request is made for non-profit, public interest, journalistic purposes.

Both the lottery, and DoJ's letter about it, are issues of extreme and urgent public concern, as it directly affects the fairness and legitimacy of the imminent Federal and swing state elections, and the ongoing lottery still being run at https://petition.theamericapac.org by the richest person on Earth. DoJ's views as to its legality, its possible intentions as to prosecution, and its decision to take an extremely unusual action of sending a letter about such activity is of grave public concern, and the widespread public dissemination of this record cannot wait until after the election renders it moot.

I therefore request full fee waiver and IMMEDIATE expedition, with a full release by the end of Monday, Oct 28.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.
